ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were walking next to the path while giving a teaching to people walking on the path. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not give a teaching while walking next to the path to anyone walking on the path who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:1.4_0: One should not give a teaching while walking next to the path to anyone walking on the path who is not sick.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching while walking next to the path to someone walking on the path who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:1.8_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:1.9_0: The twelfth training rule is finished.
